title: 103_s210
content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS for pay for Members of Congress and certain senior Federal officials. Members of Congress and certain senior Federal officials will have their annual pay rates adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. This adjustment will take effect at the beginning of the first pay period after a pay rate adjustment under the General Schedule. Members of Congress and senior Federal officials will have their pay rates adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The first adjustment will take effect in 1995, with subsequent adjustments every two years. The General Schedule pay rates will be adjusted every two years starting in 1995. Executive Schedule officers' pay rates will also be adjusted accordingly. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions will be adjusted based on the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The adjustment takes effect every two years starting in 1995. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The adjustment takes effect every two years starting in 1995. Section 215(i) of the Social Security Act determines the appropriate date for adjustments in pay rates under the General Schedule, while the salary of the Vice President is determined under section 225 of the Federal Salary Act of 1967. The Vice President's salary is adjusted based on the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100 and takes effect every applicable pay period commencing on or after the first day of the month. The Vice President's salary is adjusted based on the most recent percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year, effective on the first day of the fiscal year. SEC. 2. LIMITATION ON COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR FEDERAL ANNUITIES FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Civil Service Retirement System and the Federal Employees' Retirement System regarding adjustments to annuities based on creditable service, particularly for Members or positions under the Executive Schedule. The adjustments are limited to the lesser of the percentage increase under the current section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The amendment to the Federal Employees' Retirement System limits annuity adjustments based on creditable service to the lesser of the percentage increase under the current section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year.
